dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JESSE'S face, eyes closed, angelic, beautiful. Slowly, the CAMERA PULLS BACK and her twisted, bleeding b is revealed, tangled in a tattered dress. It appears a violent crime has just taken place. CLOSE ON a man's face. It is DEAN, handsome, slightly awkward. He stares at the scene, entranced by Jesse’s figure. He raises a still camera. Jesse’s image is reflected in miniature in the glass lens. He takes a photo, and the bl shutter closes and opens on Jesse’s body, the mechanical sound a startling contrast to the eerie quiet of the room The CAMERA PULLS BACK again, revealing that the crime sce is actually a fashion photo shoot. The clicks of Dean’s camera, uneven at first, grow rapid regular. A frenetic, percussive score. With every shot, a new image of Jesse appears on the nearby computer screen. As though waking from a dream, Jesse's eyes open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is seated in front of a mirror, staring at her reflec with wide eyes. Her face still appears bloody and battere from the shoot. She begins taking off the make-up. From across the room, RUBY, 27, simultaneously iron-wille and fragile, watches her every move. Jesse senses her gaz

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Am I staring?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Occupational hazard. Ruby waves a fist full of make-up brushes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (a revelation) You did my make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Like an hour ago. You don’t remember?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sorry -

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What, did you have a stroke between then and now?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I thought you were in the next shoot. Ruby laughs. Jesse doesn’t understand the joke.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (touched) Oh, you’re serious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Well, here, let me help you. Ruby rushes over and begins wiping away some bloody make- out of reach behind Jesse’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Ruby, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm -

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Jesse. You told me earlier. You’re a little bit deer-in-the- headlights.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I just moved here. Six weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Please don’t be from New York. Last thing we need is another pretty bitch without a soul.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm from Ridgecrest.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Where’s that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near Death Valley.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Spooky. What’s in Death Valley?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Nothing worth sticking around for. Ruby smiles, a genuine understanding.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Your skin is perfect. Look at you. She leans in, examining Jesse in the mirror, their faces nearly touching.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’re even human. (whispering) If I killed you, would you die? Ruby playfully holds up her hands, covered in bloody make RUBY (CONT’D) I swear I didn’t do it! She begins cleaning her hands with a small cloth. RUBY (CONT’D) Shit, what time is it? I promised Dee and Dum over there a ride. Ruby nods toward two ULTRA-THIN MODELS leaning against ea other in the corner of the room. They are totally bored. looks like it takes every bit of effort to hold themselve upright. RUBY (CONT’D) You think they’ve ever had lunch? Probably don’t even know what it is. ‘Wanna go to lunch?’ Probably think it’s a day-spa. (to Jesse) Hey, you wanna come? We’re going to this club in West Hollywood. Please. You'll be saving me from a thirty minute ride with the world’s only living exoskeletons. One of the thin girls sighs deeply.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Do I get shotgun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. Ruby tosses the blood-covered cloth on the make-up table. She claps loudly, startling the thin girls to life.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ashley! Mary-Kate! Andele! Party time! They stand and slink out of the room. Ruby rolls her eyes they leave. Jesse turns back to the mirror and runs a hand down the s of her face, touching her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse finishes changing. Several MODELS in various states of undress sit at a row tables as stylists scurry between them. At the corner mirror, one girl places a palm to her reflection, tears running silently down her face. Jesse notices her as she stands to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse heads through the studio toward the exit, the set f her shoot disappearing farther and farther into the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks alone through the winding hallways of the build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch from above as she spirals down a long internal staircase. The sound of wind, gradually intensifying... EXT. RUBY’S CAR/HIGHWAY - DUSK 7 CLOSE ON the sleek hood of the car, slicing through the a It flies down the highway, weaving defiantly through traf  10 11 12 13 INT. RUBY’S CAR - DUSK 8 Ruby drives, the two thin models slumped in the backseat. Jesse stares out the passenger seat window, mesmerized by neon lights of Los Angeles. Ruby pays dangerously little attention to the road in an effort to sneak looks at Jesse. One of the thin models springs to life.

dialogues.speaker: THIN GIRL
dialogues.text: You missed your exit.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Oh, it speaks. The thin girl hisses at her.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back in your cage. Ruby makes a risky maneuver on the highway and Jesse grip the car door, white-knuckled. RUBY (CONT’D) I won’t really kill you, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car exits the highway and drives into West Hollywood. EXT. RUBY’S CAR - NIGHT 10 It pulls up to the curb and screeches to a sharp halt. INT. RUBY’S CAR - NIGHT 11 Jesse releases the car door, stretching her cramped hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four girls exit the car. We watch them disappear down the street, headed to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Ruby stand inside the entrance. MUSIC BLASTS at a deafening level. The tremendous main r is completely congested with sweaty dancers. The walls, lined with floor-to-ceiling mirrors, reflect a galaxy of pretty, bouncing lights. Someone waves to Ruby across the room. She turns to Jesse and shouts over the music.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Be right back!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Don’t go anywhere. Promise?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I can’t hear you. Ruby disappears into the crowd. Jesse walks around the perimeter of the room, watching th reflections of the club in the mirrored walls. She spots a pair of eyes watching her. They belong to JAC 37, leaning casually against a pillar in a shadowed corne the room. He is striking, fashionable, and holds himself with unintentional arrogance. When their eyes connect, it unclear how long he has been looking at her. SARAH, 24, plenty of eyeliner, flirts with him, but fails hold his attention. Jack makes his thumbs and forefingers into a square, hold them up, and squints. JACK'S POV: Jesse gazes back at him, captured within the frame. Sarah sees the gesture and looks across the room for the recipient. Jesse is identified. She whips around and crashes head-first into DEAN. He smi at her.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I was hoping you would be here. Jesse cannot hear him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my friend.  14 He leans closer.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) Ruby? Do you know Ruby? He nods in acknowledgment and gestures for Jesse to follo him. They start across the room, searching for Ruby. Dean glances over his shoulder and sees Jesse struggling make her way through the crowd. He reaches out. Their hands lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Jesse push through a back door into a small, dar alcove. The MUSIC, still pulsing, is muffled. They both exhale, relieved to be away from the crowd. A LONELY SMOKER dressed in black leans against the brick while two GAY MEN kiss hungrily across from her. The smok watches them, sucking her Marlboro, unmoved. Jesse and Dean smile at the scene, then look at each othe searching for something to say.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You hungry? She shakes her head. DEAN (CONT’D) Do you want a drink? I could get you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m okay. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You did great today. By the way. At the shoot.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Thanks. He looks down, hands in pockets, and shifts nervously. Je watches him carefully, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you say... I really killed it? He looks up, surprised. She smiles, coy.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bad?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I can do worse.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Why did they build a gate around the cemetery?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Why?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Because people were dying to get in. Small laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you do with a dead chemist?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You Barium. More laughs. They move a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Okay, I’ve got one.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Is it bad?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: How bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst. Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What did one dead guy say to the other?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What? They are close enough to kiss. Dean looks down at her fac He is once again enraptured.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I - can’t remember the punch line. The moment is broken as the back door swings open and mus blasts into the alcove.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesse! Ruby heads toward them, clutching a bottle of champagne. is followed by GIGI, 21, very charming, very sexy. Ruby sizes them up, trying to decide what she interrupted

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You know Dean.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: We were just looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Clearly.  10. Gigi giggles.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I should get back in there. Nice to see you, Ruby. And -

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Gigi. Dean places a hand on the small of Jesse’s back and whisp in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Find me if you need a getaway. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Well, that was rude. Jesse smiles, unable to take her eyes off him as he walks back into the club. We move in on her face until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a POP breaks Jesse’s trance. Bubbles spill d the side of a champagne bottle. Jesse blinks and looks around the room, as though only ju realizing she is there. She glances curiously at some graffiti on the wall which reads, ‘DO WHAT THOU WILT.’ Ruby drinks straight from the bottle, perched on the edge the sink, nearly slipping. Gigi checks her reflection in bathroom mirror, smoothing the skin around her nose.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Does my nose still look swollen?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: No, but your ass does.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Very funny. Someone knocks on the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (shouts ) We're in here!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What happened to your nose?  11.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Why? Does it look bad?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Gigi’s going full Barbie.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: All plastic. Gigi slaps Ruby playfully on the backside and chases her around the room. Ruby hops on the toilet seat for safety.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sanctuary!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You had surgery?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: God, you say it like it’s a bad thing.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No, it’s just - have you done it a lot?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Not really. Ruby hiccups and holds up seven fingers behind Gigi’s bac

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I go to this guy in Beverly Hills if you want his number.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (dreamy ) Oh, Andrew...

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Doctor Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You love him.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Of course I do. Look at me. Gigi presents herself.  12. GIGI (CONT’D) He calls me the Bionic Woman.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Is that a compliment? Ruby snorts champagne. Someone knocks on the door again.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: (shouts ) We're in here!

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Where’s Sarah? I wanna dance.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Just go. She’1l be lurking around Jack for the rest of the night, poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Sarah's in love with Jack because they fucked once, like a thousand years ago -

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Be nice.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: But everyone knows he’s only interested in starving preteen babydolls -

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Hey -

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Not in front of the kid. Gigi and Ruby turn to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m not a virgin. A strange silence as the conversation comes to a halt. Gi and Ruby exchange a quick look. Ruby dangles the champagn bottle lifelessly between her knees. Another knock at the door breaks the tension. Gigi, annoy undoes the lock and Sarah bursts in, pushing Jesse behind door.  16 17 13.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well, he’s stoned out of his mind and acting like an asshole, surprise-surprise. (to Ruby) Move. Sarah pushes Ruby off the toilet and sits to pee.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll probably still go home with him because I’m such a pushover. Ruby slams the bottle on the sink and storms out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What did I say? Gigi presents Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Sarah, this is Jesse. Jesse offers a hand, but Sarah grabs the toilet paper instead.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even LOUDER MUSIC. Sarah, Gigi, and Jesse dance in the middle of the crowd. Gigi bounces around like a ball on a string. She grabs Jesse’s hand and spins her. The world whips around in circles. As she spins, Jesse sees Ruby watching them across the da floor. With each turn, Ruby’s face becomes closer and clearer, her expression hard and fixed on Jesse. The sound of RUBBER AGAINST THE ROAD as... EXT. DEAN’S CAR/HIGHWAY - NIGHT 17 The wheels of the car spin down the highway.  18 19 20 21 22 14. INT. DEAN’S CAR - NIGHT 18 Jesse stares at her reflection in the window of the car. looks past herself and sees Dean’s reflection, driving steadily. She leans her head against the window next to his image. eyes begin to close. JESSE’S DREAM 19 A fuzzy, pink surface. An image out of focus. After a while, the image becomes clear, and we realize we are loo at skin. We see an arm. A pair of shoulder blades. A collarbone. An elbow. A mouth. Odd angles of seemingly dismembered portions of a WOMAN’S BEAUTIFUL BODY. INT. DEAN’S CAR/JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT 20 CLOSE ON Dean’s face. The CAMERA PULLS BACK and we see th he is watching Jesse sleep in the passenger seat. After a few moments, her eyes open, and she looks around, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Where are we? She glances out the window. The motel is run-down, depressing, cheap. She is a little embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. How long was I asleep?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Not long. She rubs her eyes and gathers her things.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse climbs up the rusty outdoor stairs to her motel doo EXT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT -— CONTINUOUS 22 She pulls a set of keys from her bag and is about to open door when...  23 15.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. She turns and leans on the balcony rail, looking down ove Dean.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did one dead guy say to the other?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. He’s dead. Dean smiles. Jesse smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. She nods. Dean points up, and she turns her head to the sky. The fu moon is perfectly luminous. She gazes at it in awe as Dea car springs to life and drives away. She turns to her motel room. One number hangs on the door the other has long gone missing. The color has chipped aw revealing multiple coats of hideous paint. The lock takes bit of effort with the key, but it finally clicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse steps into the room, leaving the front door half op She flips the light switch a few times, but it doesn’t wo Aside from the ambient moonlight shining through the wind the room is dark and eerie. Jesse tries to see into the space. Her skin prickles as s senses that something or someone is in the room. She make out a shape in the dark which starts to approach her. She quickly steps out of the room, slamming the door shut.  24 25 16. EXT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT -— CONTINUOUS 24 Jesse stares at the door, unsure of her next move. The drapes inside the room move slightly, as if someone brush past them. She glances around her, but the parking lot is deserted. only sounds come from televisions in neighboring rooms an the muffled roar of the distant highway. She turns to the door again and takes a deep breath. She about to slip her key in the lock when a loud bang hits t door from the inside. She drops the keys and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE BELL JINGLES as Jesse runs through the door and hurriedly approaches the Night Manager, HANK. He is a fak tanned, hair-straightened, middle-aged, failed actor. He obviously once very good looking, but now borders on the grotesque. Hank sits at the front desk, feet up, cutting his nails w a small switchblade.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Someone is in my room. Unimpressed, he does not look up from his work.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: What do you mean someone is in your room?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I went to let myself in, and I heard someone. Hank takes her in.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Are you high? Jesse takes out her cell phone and starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: HANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Whoa. Relax, okay?  He snaps the blade shut and whistles to the back room. MIKEY, a skinny, grungy biker kid appears.

dialogues.speaker: HANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mikey?

dialogues.speaker: MIKEY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: This lady has an unwanted guest. 17. Mikey looks at both of them. He picks up a baseball bat. 26 EXT. JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT 26 The threesome climb the stairs. Hank, following at the re looks at Jesse’s ass and grunts, impressed. She turns aro and he winks. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse struggles to make her key work in the lock. Hank si impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Mikey, go get the spare. Uh -

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (suggestively) Jesse and I will wait here. Mikey scrutinizes the door, makes a decision, and kicks i open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 Hank shines his flashlight in the room, which we now see been torn to pieces. Jesse’s clothes are scattered everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: What the fuck? You’re going to have to pay for this.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I didn’t do it. It wasn’t me.  29 30 31 18.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Nice try, sweetheart. We don’t foot the bill for your pissed off boyfriends.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, it wasn’t me! Mikey, meanwhile, is investigating the room. He shines a flashlight across the back wall, revealing that the windo open. He moves the light down and stops on a crouched figure. I is a WILDCAT eating into the cheek of another dead animal the floor. The wildcat slowly glances up and stares into light for a moment before returning to his meal.

dialogues.speaker: MIKEY
dialogues.text: There’s your visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF A DING. Stainless steel elevator doors close on Jesse’s reflectio She grazes her fingers across her cheek, thinking about t wildcat from the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse walks down a long, stark white hallway of doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to a room crowded with plastic folding chairs. FIFTY MODELS, all variations of the same girl, si anxiously, quietly waiting. Every head snaps to Jesse as steps inside. She crosses to the CHECK-IN GIRL at a folding table in th corner. The Girl, twenty-something, smacks her gum hard a does not look up from the fashion magazine she is reading

dialogues.speaker: CHECK-IN GIRL
dialogues.text: Write down your name and your agency. Have a seat. They’ll call you in. Jesse scribbles her information on the clipboard. She pul a comp card from her bag. The Girl flips a page.  32 33 34 19. CHECK-IN GIRL (CONT’D) Just put it with the others. Jesse places her photo on top of a very tall pile. She turns around and sees every set of eyes still fixed o her. They follow her as she finds an empty folding chair the corner of the room and sits. The door swings open and every head looks to the NEW GIRL she walks in. Jesse slumps down in her seat. She pulls a pair of headphones from her bag and puts them on. MUSIC BLASTS as her thoughts leave the room...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE'S DAYDREAM 32
dialogues.text: A series of JUMP CUTS: Sun shining through the clouds. Ba feet run on hard concrete. A pair of skinny knees drop to the ground. A girl’s hands grip the edge of a swimming po We see YOUNG JESSE’s face reflected in the water. She loo at herself for a long time before reaching out a hand and skimming the surface, distorting her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse peels the nail polish off her fingernails. Every model in the room rises at once. A female CASTING ASSISTANT stands by the door, ushering the girls into the studio. Jesse rips off her headphones, gathers her things and follows the line inside. She passes the Check-in Girl, still engrossed in her magazine, as she blows an enormous bubble which threatens pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The studio is very bright. Big windows line one side of t room and racks of clothing line the other. Jesse stands with the group of girls against a side wall. They are positioned shoulder-to-shoulder, almost militant awaiting instruction.  20. In the center of the room, the fashion designer, SUJI, an elegant Korean woman in her 40s, sits at a long table. Standing behind her right shoulder is the TRANSLATOR. The Casting Assistant slams the door hard. She places the stack of comp cards on the Designer’s table and crosses t the models.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: You can undress. Like clockwork, the models strip off their jeans and t- shirts, dropping them in heaps on the ground. They stand tall in their underwear and heels. The Assistant hands each model a paper sheet with a numbe it. The FIRST MODEL is called forward. She holds up her numbe as the Assistant snaps a Polaroid. The Translator converses for an interminably long time in Korean, pointing to the model’s face and hips, clearly discussing the girl’s features. The model tries not to lo nervous. Suji remains silent, simply shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: Thank you. That will be all. The model rejoins the group as another is called forward. Jesse scans the faces behind her, wondering how long this will take. She spots an anxious SARAH in the back corner. Another model is dismissed, and Suji frowns, surveying th group. She locks eyes with Jesse. She points.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come forward please. Jesse points to herself.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you come forward? Jesse walks to the center of the room. Suji speaks.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She wants to know, how old are you?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Nineteen.  35 21. The Translator repeats this in Korean. Suji puts on her glasses and examines Jesse suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just had my birthday. Jesse fidgets. The Assistant stands in front of her and takes a Polaroid The bright flash startles her.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Raise your arms. Jesse raises her arms above her head. We see that she is very thin, her ribs clearly defined under stretched skin. The Assistant pulls a measuring tape from around her neck begins to measure the various circumferences of her body, scribbling notes on a clipboard. She notices the models watching her every move. ASSISTANT (CONT’D) How much do you weigh?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (distracted) Sorry...?

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Your weight.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: One-oh-two. The Assistant scribbles.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Can you do the walk? Jesse walks from one side of the room to the other, her H TAPPING a confident rhythm on the hardwood floor. Sarah peers behind another girl to try and get a better look. When she finishes, Jesse stands in front of the table. A long, silent moment as Suji decides. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELEVATOR DING.  36 37 22. Jesse’s smiling reflection is torn in two as the elevator doors part ways. She is about to step inside when she hea a LOUD CRASH. She turns toward the noise. The crash is followed by the SOUND OF A WOMAN CRYING. She walks slowly down the hall to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse presses her ear to the bathroom door which bears th hot pink icon of a woman’s figure.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please go away. She pushes the door open. INT. WOMEN’S RESTROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS 37 Jesse steps inside and sees SARAH’s distorted reflection front of a shattered mirror. Shards cover the sink and floor. Sarah turns toward Jesse, mascara running down her face, red from crying.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I SAID GET THE FUCK OUT! Are you deaf?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fuck, it’s you. Perfect. She slides down the bathroom wall and slumps on the groun The broken mirror crunches under her weight. Jesse notices a few cuts on Sarah’s arm which have alread begun to heal. Sarah covers them with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (defensive) I cut myself when the mirror broke. Someone tries to open the door from the outside. Jesse pushes it shut.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: We're in here.  23. They try again, and Jesse bangs on the opposite side of t door.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said we're in here! The woman gives up, mumbling some profanity. Jesse clicks the lock. Sarah is impressed. Jesse sees Sarah’s book under the sink, torn apart, and p up a photo.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you here for a casting? Sarah scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sure you were great.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I know you saw me.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It’s a great photo. You look really pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Waste of time. Everyone wants you to look like a fucking preteen. This is pointed. Jesse does look like a preteen. She knee beside Sarah and holds out the book.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I bet you can fix this. Sarah makes no move to take it.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're expensive.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Do you know how lucky you are?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  24.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. Sarah pulls the box of cigarettes from her purse, lights and sucks hard.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think God has favorites, you know? Some people are just born with more. People look at you. They notice. I walk down the street and no one sees me. I’m a ghost. She exhales and a puff of smoke winds up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that like?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: To be you? To walk into a room and all of a sudden it’s like - in the middle of winter, you’re the fucking sun. Jesse swallows.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (quietly) It’s everything. Sarah pulls Jesse toward her and puts the cigarette to he lips. Jesse takes a deep inhale, coughs.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Careful. Sarah brushes a piece of hair from Jesse’s face and tucks behind her ear. She brushes her lips down Jesse’s neck. Jesse closes her eyes, full of desire, until...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Shit! She loses her balance and stabs her hand on a piece of mirror. She rushes to the sink and runs the water. A larg triangular shard is stuck in her palm. She pulls it out, wincing, and it clinks in the drain. Blood follows.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let me see.  25.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It’s really bad.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Here, let me see it. Jesse holds out her hand. The fatty muscle is visible.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Do you think I need stitches? I don’t have insurance. Sarah is staring at the cut.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (desperately) What do I do? Sarah impulsively puts Jesse’s hand to her mouth and begi to suck the blood from the wound. Jesse tries to pull awa

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! Sarah sucks hungrily. Jesse manages to yank her hand away Sarah’s mouth is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nothing, nothing... Sarah's face streams with tears. Jesse runs from the bathroom. SARAH (CONT’D) Please don’t go! Jesse!  38 39 40 4l 42 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse scrambles to the elevator and slams her hand onto t button, leaving a streak of blood. She looks toward the bathroom. INT. WOMEN’S RESTROOM - DAY 39 Sarah looks in the cracked mirror. Her eyes are black. He mouth is covered in blood. She looks like a monster. The anger begins to rise inside of her, and she sweeps he arms across the sink, sending shards of mirror whirling across the room.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesse! INT. HALLWAY/ELEVATOR -— DAY 40 We ZOOM quickly down the hall toward Jesse as she hears h name called out. She presses the button over and over. Finally, the ELEVATOR DINGS. She rushes on and hits the button for the ground floor. The doors close on Sarah who just misses the ride. Jesse backs as far away as she can. EXT. TAXI - DUSK 4l A cloud of gray smoke coughs out of the taxi’s tailpipe. INT./EXT. TAXI/JERRY’S MOTEL - DUSK 42 Jesse pulls a few crumpled bills from her wallet and hand them to the TAXI DRIVER. He notices blood on the money. She looks for something out the window.

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: Miss? HANK stands outside, an unlit cigarette in his mouth. He struggles to make the plastic Bic lighter catch, gives up throws it across the parking lot, and enters the office.

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you alright?  43 44 45 46 27. She slides out of the taxi. EXT. JERRY’S MOTEL - DUSK 43 Jesse sprints up the outdoor stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles one-handed with the key and lock. The doorj has been rigged with duct tape, making it stick.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Come on. She looks over her shoulder and sees Hank step back out w a working lighter. She slams her weight against the door. It budges slightly. She tries again and the door swings open. Hank looks her way just as she slips inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse slams the door and does the chain. She peeks behind the curtains to see if she was spotted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's reflection in the medicine cabinet is deathly pal She opens the cabinet and examines the meager contents: toothpaste, deodorant, a bottle of peroxide. She grabs th peroxide and shuts the cabinet. She opens the bottle and pours a healthy amount over the wound on her hand, now caked in dried blood. The wound bubbles up, and the pain is almost unbearable. Jesse make sharp sound and sinks to the ground, clutching her hand t her chest. A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesse? Still reeling in pain, she braces herself on the door fra with her good hand and stands, shaky on her feet.  28.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER KNOCK.
dialogues.text: There is a deep purple bloodstain on the carpet from the wildcat. Jesse stumbles a little, dizzy. She peeks out the window. It is DEAN, shifting nervously. She opens the door and he presents a bouquet of red flowe She takes them.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Pretty. Dean peers into the motel room.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What happened in here? She starts to lose her balance.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesse! He tries to catch her, but she falls to the floor, fainti The flowers hit the ground and petals scatter everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse’s eyes blink open. Dean is crouching over her. He holds up a hand with five fingers spread wide apart.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: How many fingers do you see?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Six?! How many fingers do you have? He grabs her bad hand to check for six fingers. She wince

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened to you?  29.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Let me see. Jesse reluctantly unclenches her fist and shows Dean the wound. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I’m taking you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You need stitches.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It’s not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Not that bad? You fainted.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I know, I know. I just - I didn’t eat today and -

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You didn’t eat?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m feeling much better. Honestly.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you eat?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I - forgot. Dean eyes her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please don’t look at me like that. They sit in silence for a moment. Dean looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: This place is a mess.  30.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: This fucking cat got in and wrecked everything.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Real party animal?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It ate my face cream. Small laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You can’t stay here.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I don’t know where else to go.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I’ve got a couch. She shoots him a look. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Worth a shot.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Besides, I can’t leave.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I owe them money.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: For the damages.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: It wasn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I left the window open.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: So you try telling him. The guy’s a creep. He won’t listen.  49 31. Dean looks at her, propped up against the bed, clutching hand. She is incredibly small. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE BELL JINGLES as Dean enters the office door. HANK has his feet up, flipping through an out-of-date Hus Magazine and shovelling sticky, red Chinese food into his mouth with a fork.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Are you the Manager?

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Depends on who’s asking.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: My friend says she owes you money. This gets Hank’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: That so?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Room twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Oh... The wildcat! Hank growls. His mouth is covered in red sauce.

dialogues.speaker: HANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s some hard candy, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I’m sure I don’t. Hank looks him up and down.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: What are you, a Mormon?  32.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: You with the DPH? Cuz we passed our last inspection. I’11 show you the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I’m a photographer.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: A photag, huh? Take any of these? He holds up the nude magazine.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Not my style.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Hmm. Hank turns back to the magazine, instantly sucked into on the pictures. For a minute he forgets about Dean. Dean clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: HANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right. Back to business. Your little friend’s a piece of work. Gonna have to replace the door and do a new spackle on the wall. Looking at... at least two-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Fine. Dean takes out his wallet and produces a wad of money. Ha eyes it hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Or was it three? They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I have two-forty in cash.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Sold! Hank rips the bills from his hand. He goes to a filing cabinet and unlocks the top drawer. He takes out a cash b counts the money, and puts it inside.  50 33.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: There a pharmacy around here?

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Why? She send you out for tampons, too?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You've got a real attitude problem.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: That’s what I hear.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I could report you.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Hey, now. I’m just being friendly. Just wanna make sure you’re getting something out of this deal. Symbiotic relationship, you know? Cuz if you're not - (whispers ) Got plenty other girls here. Take a peek in room twenty-two if you get a chance. Rented it yesterday to a girl from Sandusky, Ohio. Run away from home. Thirteen years old. He sucks air through his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: HANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now that’s some Lolita shit, you know what I mean? Hank grunts and moans, suggestively rubbing his body agai the filing cabinet. The drawers make a rattling sound as Hank molests the cabinet, his efforts increasing, slappin hand against the metallic side. Dean leaves, repulsed. The BELL JINGLES as Hank calls aft him.

dialogues.speaker: HANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Room twenty-two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pass the row of motel doors, past room twenty-four, tw three, twenty-two... stopping at Jesse’s room: number twe one.  51 52 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ZOOM in slowly on Jesse’s body, lying motionless on th bed. She appears to be asleep until we see her eyes, open wide. She stares at a patch of wall covered in deep gashe from the wildcat. IMAGES FLASH through her mind: The wildcat’s yellow eyes. The models looking her up and down. Sarah’s bloody mouth. Suddenly, Dean shoves the door open with some force and stumbles inside. He carries a plastic sack from the drugstore.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (re: the door) They'll fix that soon. Jesse runs to him and wraps her arms around his waist. Surprised by this sudden gesture of intimacy, he runs a gentle hand through her hair, curling the soft waterfall strands through his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sits on the toilet seat, knees to her chest like a child. Dean kneels beside her, picking a small shard of mirror from the cut with a pair of tweezers. She winces. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It doesn’t hurt. He dabs a damp piece of tissue around the wound, places a large Band-Aid over the cut, and wraps it tightly in an a bandage.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Best I can do.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You’re welcome. He thinks about kissing her, but instead starts to clean  53 54 35.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (sincere) I’m having a really good time. He looks up, smiles, completely charmed.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Anything else need fixing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crunchy, metal SOUND OF A MOTOR attempting to rev to life. Dean tries to start Jesse’s car, a run-down Buick past it prime. He has been working at it for some time, and sweat beads cover his brow. Jesse sits on the back bumper watching. Frustrated, Dean powers through one last attempt. We see motor of the car as it springs to life. He slams the hood and wipes his greasy hands. Behind him, the sun sets in brilliant red and orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The relentless, high-pitched RING OF A TELEPHONE. Sitting rigid at a desk is JAN CAMPBELL-COOPER, a ferocio attractive thirty-something sporting a tight-lipped smile a power suit with a plunging neckline. Every word from he mouth drips with sing-song saccharine despite her dying patience. A framed magazine cover bearing a photo of Jan as a model her earlier days hangs askew behind the desk. Jesse sits in a shabby upholstered chair, pulling at a lo thread as they wait in silence for the phone to desist.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Cara, sweetie, would you like to answer the phone today? Through the door, we see Jan’s twiggy, perky, blonde assistant CARA gabbing with the MAIL CLERK, unaware of th phone’s insistence.  36.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a little too harsh)

dialogues.speaker: CARA
dialogues.text: Cara jumps. She picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: CARA
dialogues.text: Jan Campbell-Cooper’s Office. Oh, hi, Brad! (whispering) It’s your ex-husband. Jan closes the office door with force.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Next time, remind me to hire someone with a hump or a skin disease. She sits on the corner of the desk. Smiles again. Poised.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to talk about your future.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: You've been getting a lot of attention lately.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I have?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: The [DESIGNER NAME] people called this morning. They said you were absolutely perfect. I’m not surprised. Jan sucks down half a can of Diet Coke through a clear- plastic straw and scrutinizes Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Where do you see yourself in five years? Jesse shrugs.  37.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t be shy.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Working more high-end, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Mmhmm.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'd like to go to New York for September.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Well, well! Aren’t you Miss Confident! And I mean it as a good thing. Those goals are perfectly achievable. Let me put this another way. What do you think about Paris?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Paris?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: And after that, Milan. London. Singapore.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sounds okay.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Okay? This is every little girl’s dream! Get you out of the New Faces and into Vogue. You'll work for all the big designers. International success.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sounds great. Jan straightens her photo on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: You know, one time I met Valentino while I was doing a runway show in Rome. He kissed me right here. She points to the very corner of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think about that? Jan turns to Jesse, expectant.  38.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Wow...? Jan turns back to the photo, her face reflected in the gl Jesse attempts to recover.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were so beautiful. Jan frowns at the past tense.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: We're sending you next week. You have five days to pack your things and tell all your boyfriends goodbye. We’ll cover your housing and your travel expenses, of course. Don’t be worried about that. You don’t need to do anything up front, just pay us back with the money you’1l make overseas. How does that sound?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sounds amazing.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Cara will have you fill out a W2 and all that nonsense. It’s very simple since you’re over eighteen. Jesse pulls harder at the loose thread in the fabric.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are eighteen...?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: It says nineteen in your file.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: That might be a mistake. Jan grins, knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Stay right there. She walks out of the office, shutting the door behind her  55 56 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan marches up to Cara.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: I need a parental consent for a minor. International. Cara rummages through her desk which is in total disarray Jan looks over at three other HOPEFUL MODELS sitting in a of chairs. She shoots them a half smile. She speaks to Ca through clenched teeth.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to keep the others in reception.

dialogues.speaker: CARA
dialogues.text: I thought this would be better.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Oh, you thought it would be better.

dialogues.speaker: CARA
dialogues.text: (confused) That’s what I just said. Jan rips the paperwork out of Cara’s hand and storms back into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan hands a stack of forms to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: All we need is a signature giving parental consent. Just one little signature, right there, and off you go. Jesse takes the papers, looking closely at the line readi ‘Parent or Guardian.”

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that a problem?  57 40. Jesse shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. Now, we need to work on your book before you go, so I’ve arranged for a test shoot. It’s thirteen-hundred, which I know sounds astronomical, but again, we'll cover it. A small price to pay for all the work you'll get later, right? This guy is the best in the business. Real Jackson- Pollock-meets-Marlon-Brando type. And his photos are good, too. So my advice is... Don’t mess it up, honey. She hands Jesse a slip of paper with an address.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can meet him at one. INT. JACK’S STUDIO - DAY 57 Elevator doors close shut behind a frozen Jesse. On the other side of the studio is JACK. A silent moment passes between them. Jesse is acutely aware that they are alone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Come closer. Jesse walks to him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take off your clothes. She looks around for a place to change. The studio is modest, minimal, clean. Brick walls and large windows. Various lighting instruments and a small desk in the corn

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No. She tosses her bag on the ground and strips to her underw She stands tall, awaiting instruction.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: All the way.  41. Jesse swallows hard. She slips her underwear down her leg brushing them to the side with a foot. She unhooks her br and drops it to the ground. He stares at her for a long time. It is not sexual, rathe the look of a sculptor sizing up an untouched ivory block

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pull your hair up and turn. She does. The idea comes to him. He walks out of the room, and Jess is left alone. Shivering, she attempts to cover her body with her arms. The rays of sunlight shooting through the window shine down on her like a spotlight. He returns carrying a large metal box and a bundled plast tarp. He stretches the tarp out in the corner of the room smoothing every corner with great care and deliberation. He motions for Jesse to come. He opens the box and examines the contents, making his selection. Curious, Jesse tries to peer inside.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put this on. He tosses the object to her. She drops it, nervous, and bends down to pick it up before he notices. It is a tube gold paint. Jack cleans a lens with a small cloth and attaches it to camera base on a tripod.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Um — She looks at the tube, unsure of what to do.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry - He either doesn’t hear her or doesn’t care to respond.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to do with this. He goes to her and takes the tube.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.  58 42. He squeezes a good amount of paint on his hand. He stands behind her, placing a hand at her collarbone. A SERIES OF JUMP CUTS: He slides his hand across her ches Between her breasts. Down the soft flesh of her belly... JESSE'S POV: Jack stands back and admires his work, wipin his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Over there. He motions for her to stand in front of the camera. He clicks a small remote and MUSIC begins to play through th studio. We only see Jack as he stands behind a camera and begins take pictures. He stops, looks up, unhappy. He walks out frame to adjust something, then back to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look stiff.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How’s this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Better. He clicks a few more photos. He takes the camera off the tripod and walks closer, the CLICKS OF THE CAMERA growing rapid and regular, louder and louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jesse in the mirror covered head-to-toe in gold, t portrait of a Greek Goddess. She runs a hand down her bod amazed that it belongs to her.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The Midas Touch. Jesse is surprised to see Ruby reclining behind her. RUBY (CONT’D) At least it’s not blood. Ruby makes a face, plays dead.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Have you been here the whole time?  59 43.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: That’s what they pay me for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby plunges her hand into a small basin of water which sloshes onto the floor. She worshipfully washes the paint off Jesse's body. Jesse stares off.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Did your dog die or something?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: So serious. Ruby pokes Jesse’s face with her index finger.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You disappeared the other day.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Where’d you go?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I've been house-sitting.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: House-sitting emergency?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Had to take care of some things.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I had to water the plants. What’s with the third degree? Jesse looks down.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: He didn’t say anything after the shoot.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Is that what you’re worried about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse nods. RUBY (CONT’D) Well what did you want him to do? Fuck you? Jesse looks away, red-faced. RUBY (CONT’D) You did.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: God, you’re worse than Sarah. Jack walks in.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Jan's office said you need these in a rush, so I’ll have them by the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay. He starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good work, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Thanks. He goes. Jesse exhales, deeply relieved.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Maybe he will. Jesse slaps her playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby and Jesse, clean and dressed, sit at a table staring the agency paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I don’t see what the problem is. Just get the signature.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Not possible.  61 45.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: So sign it yourself. It’s not like you're robbing a bank. It’s a signature. How old are you, anyway? Jesse hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not a cop.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sixteen last month.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Jesus. Got your license and hit the road, huh? This strikes a nerve. Jesse looks at the papers, forlorn. RUBY (CONT’D) One time in the sixth grade Scott Masterson and I snuck into the science lab. We stole the answers to the Chem final and sold them for a buck each. I never got caught.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Did he?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Look, the point is, sometimes you have to do something a little bit bad to get something really, really good. And usually, no one ever finds out. Jesse looks at the papers. Ruby nudges her, chanting ‘sig sign-sign.’ Jesse scribbles the signature. Ruby tosses tissues into the air like confetti, a celebration. RUBY (CONT’D) Hey, you wanna do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a hamster jogging infinite circles on a wheel in window of the pet shop. Jesse and Ruby stand outside.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What if he asks my name?  62 46.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Tell him the truth. Or lie. Whatever. Just don’t let him turn around. Jesse looks anxious. RUBY (CONT’D) I helped you, you help me. Right? Jesse nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHAOS OF ANIMALS barking, chirping, crying. Jesse leans both elbows on the glass counter by the front register. A scrawny SALES CLERK saunters over in a bright blue and yellow work uniform.

dialogues.speaker: SALES CLERK
dialogues.text: Can I help you? A name-tag clipped to his shirt reads: CONRAD.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Are you Conrad?

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: That’s me.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I need help finding something.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: Okay. She points behind the counter to a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fish pellets?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: What kind of fish do you have?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Um... a red one? Jesse looks as sheepish as possible. Conrad thinks she’s adorable.  47.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I come back and take a look? He motions her behind the counter. As they turn away from the door, Ruby slips inside and disappears to the back.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: So these are flakes and these are pellets. Really, they’re the same thing, just depends on how much you want to spend. This is fourteen- ninety-nine, but it’1l last you a year.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Can I see? He unscrews the cap. Jesse glances over her shoulder. No Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: Should I ring you up?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Do you like - fish?

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: They’re okay. I mean, they’re pretty much non-pets, right? She is running out of ammunition. He looks at her with curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want a brochure or something?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Wait - Too late. Conrad turns around just as Ruby is sneaking toward the exit carrying a large brown paper sack.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) Run! Jesse ducks under Conrad's arm, spilling the jar of fish food. The girls fly out the door. 63 EXT. STREET/JESSE’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS 63 Jesse and Ruby charge down the street toward the car.  64 65 48.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Unlock the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall into the car, sliding deep into the seats. Ruby looks back to see if they were followed. The paper bag on her lap shakes violently.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What’s in that? Ruby smiles mischievously. She reaches in the sack and produces a large orange and yellow cockatiel.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it expensive?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: They wouldn’t sell him to me.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Why not? She runs a finger down his back.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Isn't he beautiful? CONRAD appears out of nowhere, banging on the car window. Ruby loses hold of the bird which goes flying through the car. Jesse turns the key in the ignition, but the car won start.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurry up! She tries again. The car roars to life. Ruby flips Conrad the bird as they floor it down the stre INT. RUBY’S APARTMENT - DAY 65 They enter the apartment and Ruby immediately disappears the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You want something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No, thanks.  49. Ruby’s living room is a bona fide zoo. A giant cage holds least thirty restless parakeets, flapping and CHIRPING incessantly. An upset deck of tarot cards is strewn acros the coffee table. On the wall, a framed quote: “The light mine. Its rays consume me.” Jesse scans a shelf, running her fingers across a row of books including The Holy Book of Thelema and Magic and Alchemy. She selects a thick, leatherbound book, opening a page covered in Latin scrawl and a reverse Pentagram. Ruby reappears with the cockatiel in a small cage.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I should name him Conrad. What do you think? Jesse looks up from the book.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Are you a witch? Ruby laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Just some things I’m interested in.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Do you believe in it? This... magic stuff?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Some of it. Jesse flips a page. Ruby watches her intently. RUBY (CONT’D) What do you believe in? Jesse shrugs. RUBY (CONT’D) Everyone believes in something. Jesse flips the page to images documenting various animal sacrifice rituals. She glances nervously at the birdcage.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Why wouldn’t they sell you the bird?  66 67 50.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Because they’re a bunch of Fascists. Ruby grabs the book and puts it back on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Me, too. Plants won’t water themselves. Jesse starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Thanks again for your help.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Hey. Friends, right? They share a smile. EXT. JESSE’S BUICK - DAY 66 Jesse’s phone RINGS as she walks to the car. She beams wh she sees the name on the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What do you call a cow with no legs?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ground beef. Small laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've been waiting to tell you that one all day. INT. RUBY’S APARTMENT - DAY - CONTINUOUS 67 Ruby leans against the large cage in the corner and makes kissing noises. She opens the gate and refills the water with a paper cup.  68 69 51.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Guess what?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I booked a show tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I’1l see you after.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'd like that. Ruby sprinkles feed inside. The birds go wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOSTILE WHIR OF A SEWING MACHINE. A woman’s callused hands run a piece of fabric through it, her fingers dangerously close to the needle. SEAMSTRESSES hustle about. Jesse stands before one of the rollers in her hair, arms outstretched, as last minute alterations are made. Beside her, two CHATTY MODELS laugh and talk animatedly in FRENCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sits at a make-up mirror, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look what the cat dragged in. GIGI’s reflection appears behind her. Her face is made-up and a pink robe hangs open over her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got a secret. She flops into the neighboring chair, flinging her legs o the side, and sucks down a tiny bottle of champagne from straw.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Spill.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I don’t have a secret.  52.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Come on. Give me the gossip. Are you pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Are you in love?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: You are! You’re in love.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I am not.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Then why are you blushing? Jesse's excitement overcomes her.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: They're sending me to Paris.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Paris, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Next week.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Quelle superbe nouvelle!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh, god. Do you think they’1l be upset that I don’t speak French?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Relax. You’re not joining the debate team. No one cares about what you say. Gigi picks up a bright lipstick and absentmindedly applie in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Did you look different? I mean before?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: You wouldn't even recognize me.  70 53.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Do you think you look better now?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I get more work, if that’s what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I guess some people are just born with more. Gigi laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that? Jesse shrugs. GIGI (CONT’D) The way I see it... God made man, but He also made Dr. Andrew. Why just be pretty when you can be perfect?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Some people say that God’s a woman.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Well then she definitely understands. They share a smile. GIGI (CONT’D) I love this color on me. Gigi leans into the mirror. She kisses her reflection, leaving an electric red lipstick mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse attempts to peer into the crowd. JESSE'S POV: Hundreds of men and women take their seats. The flash of a camera startles her, and she turns over he shoulder. We see her fully made-up for the first time. Sh wears flesh-colored lingerie, loads of make-up, and a thi gold band across her forehead like a crown. She is completely transformed.  71 72 54. The flash belongs to JACK, taking backstage photos. Anoth shot, and Jack walks away. She watches him go, sliding a hand across her stomach. The lights grow dim. A WOMAN’S VOICE introduces the show. The STAGE MANAGER runs around frantically. Jesse takes he place in line. The SOUND OF APPLAUSE. MUSIC BLASTS as the first girl makes her way onto the run Gigi, close to the front, turns around and winks at Jesse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse steps out onto the runway and the MUSIC STOPS. TIME SLOWS. Nothing but the rapid crescendo of her BREATHING. We see her face as she begins to walk, eyes determined. W see her torso. Her hipbones. Her feet. Flashes of camera light bounce across portions of her body, dissected in motion. When she reaches the end, the BREATHING STOPS. JESSE'S POV: A sea of illuminated eyes looking directly a her. CLOSE ON her face. The hint of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC again as Jesse exits backstage, ecstatic. She sees Jack across the room and walks confidently up to him, pulling him into a corner. She grabs his hand and places it between her legs. He raises his eyebrows in surprise, realizing that she is very wet. She kisses him hungrily, pulling his body against hers. Then, a voice.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesse? Jesse looks up, lipstick smeared across her face. She see Dean as he charges at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Dean, don’t!  73 74 75 55. He slams Jack hard against the wall. His camera crashes t the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: He’s nobody. Jesse’s comment makes Dean’s head turn and while he is no paying attention, Jack clocks him. Dean tumbles backwards and trips over a rack of women’s clothing. The whole thin topples over.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jack) I’m sorry - Jack picks up his camera and storms off. Gigi and a small group of girls have surrounded the scene snickering. SUJI breaks through the spectators to check o the commotion. She looks disappointedly at Jesse and walk away. Dean cannot stand, tangled in a mess of clothes. Jesse st over him.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Jesse -

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Just go. INT./EXT. JESSE'S CAR/JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT 73 Oil drips beneath the parked car. Out the window, Jesse s Dean waiting on the steps of the motel. EXT. JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT 74 Jesse approaches him, still made-up from the show. His ey has already started turning purple. She marches past.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Can we please talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse storms into the room, Dean on her heels.  56.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Jesse —

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What were you doing there?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I thought you invited me.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I realize that.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: That's my job, Dean.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: My job. You have no idea how much you've fucked things up.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Let me talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: It’s the least I can do.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Stop trying to be the nice guy. Stop fixing things. Sometimes people don’t want to be saved.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I’m just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I don’t want your help.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t want to be one of those guys who gets into fights over a girl.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You’re not one of those guys.  76 77 78 79 80 81 57.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Why does that sound like an insult? Jesse sits on the bed, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? Huh? I don’t even know you. Not really. You're just some guy who gave me a ride one time. This hits hard.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think you should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean walks slowly down the stairs. INT./EXT. MOTEL MANAGEMENT/DEAN’S CAR - NIGHT - CONTINUOU HANK watches Dean through the window as he gets in the ca and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 77 78 Jesse sits on the bed, staring into space. Her eyes land the red flowers from Dean. She has failed to put them in water, and they are wilting on top of the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tosses the flowers into the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws herself onto the bed, completely spent. She clicks the bedside lamp off sending the room into total darkness and begins to drift to sleep. EXT. JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT A pair of men’s feet walk quietly up the outdoor stairs. 79 80 81  82 83 84 85 86 58. EXT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT -— CONTINUOUS 82 The feet stop in front of Jesse's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. The feet creep to Jesse’s bedside. Fingers rub greedily against sweaty palms. We see that th belong to HANK. He looks down on Jesse, sleeping quietly, his expression full of longing. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out the switchblade. Opens it. He sticks the blade between her slightly open lips. Between her teeth. Down into the soft hollow of her mouth. Jesse wakes. She sees the knife and freezes, fearful of slicing her tongue on the blade. She locks eyes with HANK who is panting hard.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Wider. After a beat, Jesse opens her mouth wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens wider still, the skin of her mouth stretched ta at the corners. He sticks the blade down into her throat. She begins to gag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sits upright in bed. She flips on the light and loo around the room for Hank, but she is alone. She holds a h to her mouth, realizing it was all a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool water runs in the sink as Jesse splashes her face. S has not removed her make-up, and it is smudged across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse lies back on the bed and curls into the fetal posit She picks up her phone from the nightstand and sees that has two missed calls. She ignores them, and clicks the li off again.  87 88 89 90 59. While attempting to drift back to sleep, the SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS startles her. A man’s shadow looms outside her window. She rushes to do the chain-lock, backing into the dark corner. She watches the shadow pass under her door t the neighboring room. Jesse puts an ear to the wall. The faint whispers of a YO GIRL’S VOICE, startled by the unexpected company. Her eye widen as the whispers become FEARFUL CRIES. Some awful violence is taking place in the room next door. CUT TO: Behind the wall. Jesse is silhouetted as the CAME TRACKS BACKWARD creating a tunnel effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUBY opens the front door. JESSE clutches a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stands naked in a hot shower, her face lifted to th showerhead. Black makeup runs down her neck and chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrapped in a white towel, she draws the large outline of heart with her finger on the foggy mirror in front of her She stares at the heart before wiping it away, revealing image. For the first time, we see her without any make-up or glamour. She looks incredibly young, a girl of sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is luxurious, clean, comfortable - the complete opposite of Jerry’s Motel. She towel-dries her hair as sh walks around, examining things. A reflection appears in the window. Jesse whips around, startled by Ruby standing in the doorway. She attempts to cover her nude body with the towel.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I brought you something. She holds up a small bottle.  91 92 93 94 60.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What is it? She points to Jesse’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Helps it heal. Jesse sits on the bed. Ruby carefully unwinds the bandage and doctor's her injured hand. RUBY (CONT’D) There.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Ruby looks down at her exposed body.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You have such beautiful skin. Jesse swallows hard. Ruby touches her ankle, up her leg, over her knee, to the inside of her thigh. Their eyes lock as Ruby penetrates her. Jesse’s face scrunches into a tight ball, a mix of pain and pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby washes her hands in the sink. They shake nervously, she drops the small soap into the basin with a clink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheer curtains wave at the open window, the only move in the room. Ruby sits motionless on the edge of the bed, gripping her cell phone. After a long moment, she dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon shines bright in the sky above the monstrous, gl house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's eyes are already wide open as the first rays of sunshine pour in the window.  95 96 97 98 99 61. Her cell phone vibrates incessantly on the nightstand. Sh looks at it with disdain. She yanks open the back window and impulsively tosses the phone outside. It goes flying into the grass below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ruby? No response. She twists the knob and enters. The bed is mussed and unmade, but Ruby is not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, dressed, turns the key in the ignition. The car refuses to cooperate, and the dashboard lights up as it d completely.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse crawls on her hands and knees searching for her pho in the grass. The sun beats down. Eventually giving up, s sits back on her heels and wipes sweat from her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse examines a wall of framed photographs. A smiling tr MOTHER, FATHER, and SIX-YEAR-OLD-BOY are present in most. She stops at a picture of the young boy at Halloween dres in a homemade astronaut costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse fingers glass perfume bottles arranged in neat rows the vanity. She picks up a lipstick and puts it on, imitating Gigi.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I love this color on me.  100 101 102 103 62. She opens a drawer of the vanity and finds several pair o glasses. She tries on a few, twists up her hair, turning, admiring her reflection. She sees the open closet door behind her and has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse flips the light-switch and her jaw drops. The colos walk-in closet is any woman’s fantasy, boasting floor to ceiling mirrors and racks of expensive-looking clothes. Jesse thumbs through them, stopping at a beautiful red evening gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
