dialogues.text: Jesse walks around the perimeter of the room in the gown. is slightly too large, and she looks very much like she i playing dress-up. Her fingers lightly trail the glass wal as she watches her reflection pass beside her. She stops and looks through her own image to the backyard There is a giant rectangular swimming pool. She smiles. We hear LOUD MUSIC on the radio as... INT. RUBY’S CAR - DAY 102 Ruby sits in a parking lot, looking at herself in the rearview mirror for a long time. She turns the key and th MUSIC STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby stands inside the diner. RUBY’S POV: SARAH and GIGI sit on the far side of the roo Ruby slides into the opposite side of the booth. No one speaks. Eventually, a WAITRESS walks over, breaking the silence.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Would anyone like to hear the specials?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Sure.  63. Sarah groans. GIGI (CONT’D) What? They work so hard to memorize them.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Today is Thursday, so we’re serving breakfast all day. We have a loaded baked potato with a side of broccoli or a fruit cup for seven- ninety-nine. We have a lovely pan- seared halibut topped with a mango- peach salsa on a bed of wild rice served with a fruit cup. And we have a steak sandwich which comes with fries.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: If I don’t want fries, could I substitute the fruit cup?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Could I have the fruit cup without it being on the side of anything?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: If you just want fruit, you’1l have to order the fruit bowl -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know, we’re not that hungry. Thanks, though.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (confused) You do know this is a restaurant? Sarah looks at her with killing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Three waters.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: And a fruit cup. The Waitress walks away. Another silence as the three eye each other. Finally, Sarah speaks.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: She’s at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red gown lies in a heap on the floor. We track up Jesse's body as she ties the top of a bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tosses the towel on a patio chair. She climbs the ladder of the diving board. A SHARP SCREAM. A YOUNG WOMAN is being chased around the neighboring backyard. A YOUNG MAN catches her and throws her over his shoulder, upside down. The young woman squeals with delig Jesse frowns. She turns away. She walks to the edge of the diving board and jumps high the air. The sound of the DIVING BOARD SPRINGS. Mid-air, she twists and lands back on the board, clinging it with both arms, struggling to maintain her balance. She looks with horror at the concrete bottom of the pool which holds no water, only two large round drains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby stands by the front door, keys in hand, and calls ou

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby looks around the room. No Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby is on her way to the back door when she hears a nois She follows the sound. Jesse sits on the floor, tucked behind a big armchair in her bathing suit, a half-empty bottle of wine beside her.  65.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Did you go swimming?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tried to. Jesse laughs hysterically, teetering on the edge of drunk

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What’s so funny? Jesse's laughter fades to nothing. She is very still, contemplative. She snaps She takes

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: When I was eleven, I asked my mother for a swimming pool. I begged and begged. Please let me have a swimming pool. Please. Of course she said no. But my Stepdad, he said, ‘You want a swimming pool, you got a swimming pool.’ Two months later - her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My mother told me I was dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: She was right. She wasn’t wrong. I know what I look like.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I’m sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with that anyway? Am I supposed to feel bad? Sometimes, I look at myself and I think, I actually think - God! Was there ever anything better than this? I mean, look at me. What else is there? a drink.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it isn’t just being beautiful. It’s more than that. It’s power. You asked me what I believe in? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I believe in me. Men look at me. Women look at me. Everyone either wants me or wants to be me. And you know what? I love it. Jesse exhales deeply, relieved, as though she had been dy to get this out for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need more wine. Jesse pulls herself to her feet. Ruby watches, but makes effort to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse grabs a fresh bottle of wine from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts back to the living room with the wine, but is stopped by a NOISE behind her.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ruby? Jesse follows the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is open wide. Jesse shuts it. She puts one eye to the peephole. JESSE'S POV: Outside is mostly dark, obscured shadows. After a long moment, she turns around. She is startled by SARAH standing motionless in front of her. Jesse is instantly tense. CLOSE ON her wounded hand as she balls it into a fist, recalling their last interaction.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Sarah does not offer a response. They face-off for a long moment until... Sarah lunges toward Jesse. The bottle of wine is dropped, smashing on the ground.  112 113 114 67. EXT. HILLS HOUSE - NIGHT —- CONTINUOUS 112 Jesse opens the front door and runs a few steps outside, Sarah catches her. She clamps a hand over Jesse’s mouth, dragging her back inside, ripping her bare feet on the ha concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse grabs the door frame and struggles wildly. Sarah sl the door and it closes hard on Jesse’s wounded hand. Once Twice. Three times. Jesse cries out and finally releases the door, sinking to ground and clutching her hand. Sarah takes this moment to the lock. Jesse crawls across the broken bottle and scrambles to he feet, barely getting away. She runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jesse’s reflection run through the room, Sarah’s i hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse scrambles up the stairs. She stumbles, and Sarah gr her foot. Jesse kicks her in the face. Sarah’s nose drips with blood. Jesse crawls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse runs down the hall and ducks into the first room sh sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shuts the door and flips off the lights. She turns around. The walls and ceiling are covered in glow-in-the- dark planets and constellations, a magnificent replica of outerspace. Jesse is stopped in awe. She is brought back to earth when she hears FOOTSTEPS in hall. She ducks into the closet and shuts the door.  120 121 122 123 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pulls her knees to her chest and holds her breath. The sound of the DOOR OPENING. Light pours in the crack under the closet door. Jesse puts her own hand over her mouth to quiet her breathing.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispered) Jesse? Jesse backs farther into the closet and bumps into a chil spaceship toy. The toy lights up wildly, making ‘BLAST-OF NOISES. She panics. The closet door swings open. It is RUBY. INT. HILLS HOUSE CHILD’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS 119 Jesse flies out of the closet and clings to Ruby. Ruby pu a finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (whispering) We’ll go out the back. She grabs Jesse’s hand and peeks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Ruby walk hand-in-hand toward the stairs. INT. HILLS HOUSE STAIRWAY - NIGHT —- CONTINUOUS 121 The pair runs down quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make it to the back door, and Ruby opens it. Jesse r out ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH is standing motionless beside the pool holding a ha to her bloody nose. Jesse quickly turns back to Ruby, who shuts the door firmly behind her. Ruby looks down, refusi to meet her gaze. Jesse’s eyes widen as she realizes that Ruby is part of whatever is going on.  124 125 126 127 69. Jesse backs away from both of them. GIGI steps out of the shadows behind her. She pushes Jesse in the pool. TIME SLOWS as she falls. A CRUNCH as she hits the hard, cement bottom. She grimace in pain and grabs her now broken leg. We see Jesse from above, lying on her back, twisted in th rectangular grave. JESSE'S POV: The full moon shines bright in the sky above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of RUNNING WATER as a showerhead springs to lif Ruby, Sarah, and Gigi are naked in the shower, covered he to toe in blood. They vigorously scrub their bodies, very focused. Ruby washes her hands. Sarah lets water run into her mouth. Gigi pulls a thick substance from her hair. Thin, red water circles down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three girls dry off, making little eye contact. Gigi wraps a white towel around her body. In the foggy mirror, she sees the faint outline of a heart. She clutches her stomach, suddenly nauseated. She falls t all fours and vomits. A human eye is in the vomit. It see to look directly at her. Without missing a beat, Sarah picks up the eye and puts i her mouth, popping it with her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinklers pop up in the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a SQUEAKY SPIGOT turning. Water sprays through a garden hose across pretty red rose bushes lining the fence. Ruby walks around the perimeter the backyard watering the plants, her house-sitting duty.  128 129 70. When she is finished, she hesitantly walks to the edge of pool and looks down into it. We only see her face as she grimaces. She sprays the hose into the pool. The SOUND OF WATER tak us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby scrubbing her hands aggressively in the kitchen sink She flips off the sink, examines them, turning them over. They are red, rubbed raw. Satisfied, she dries them on a dishtowel. She frowns at the stove, buried under dirty pots and pans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby enters the dining room. She looks in disgust at Sara who is devouring a plate of eggs and bacon. Sarah shoots her a toothy grin, her mouth full.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: The kitchen’s a mess.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Relax. I'll clean it.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: They're coming home -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This afternoon. I heard you the first hundred times. Ruby sits, defeated, looking especially fragile. Gigi runs in, her hair dripping.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I took another shower. She slides into a seat at the table. Ruby notices a littl blood behind Gigi'’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?  71.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You have some - Ruby points to the blood.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Damn. Will you get it? Gigi grabs a napkin and hands it to Ruby. Ruby lowers her head and cries quietly. Sarah puts her utensils down.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Shut up, Sarah. Sarah mouths the words ‘all night’ to Gigi.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Everything okay, Ruby?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Post-traumatic stress. She’ll get over it. Ruby turns to Sarah in a burst of sudden rage.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I want to know how you can eat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s the most important meal of the day.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Fucking animal.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (her mouth full) Hey! What did I do that you didn’t do? Gigi shoots Sarah a look. SARAH (CONT’D) What? She’s the one who found her, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Be nice.  72.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Ruby) Remember? ‘The only virgin in LA, and I got her.’

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: That was a joke.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You still laughing?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I didn’t - How could I know what I was doing?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It was your idea! We went to visit Gigi after she had her - Sarah gestures to her whole face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She looked like a human punching bag. And she said, ‘I wish there was an easier way.’ Didn’t you say that, Geeg? And Ruby, you said, ‘There is.’ You planned it. You found her. Ruby grabs Sarah’s plate and smashes it against the table It breaks into pieces. Sarah stands, ready for the fight.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Hey! Sarah sits, ending the standoff. GIGI (CONT’D) What do we do with her car?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: We get rid of it.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: What about her -

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: It’s done.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? What’s done?  73.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: The... rest of her. Ruby begins to weep again. GIGI (CONT’D) Sweetie...

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I can’t be a part of this.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: But you are a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I have to go. We have to tell someone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (to Gigi) She was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I know, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I’ve never been like you - I’ve never felt like I was -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus. SHUT UP. Sarah's fist is balled tight, white-knuckled.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: But she was a person. I’ve never thought about what it means to be a person. Have you?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: No. Ruby looks down at her hands. They are suddenly covered i blood. She shoots out of her chair, sending it flying beh her.  130 74.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What is it? Ruby holds her hands in front of her, screaming uncontrollably. Sarah grabs a piece of the broken plate and stabs through center of Ruby’s throat, slicing her vocal chords. Ruby’s eyes bug out as she tries to speak. GIGI (CONT’D) WHAT THE FUCK?! What the fuck did you do? Ruby makes raspy croaking sounds. GIGI (CONT’D) She can’t breathe! We have to call an ambulance! We need to take her to the hospital! Sarah watches Ruby gasp for breath, the plate in her hand

dialogues.speaker: DO SOMETHING
dialogues.text: Sarah forces Ruby to her knees and slices her deep across throat. Blood shoots from her jugular splattering Gigi an half the table. She falls limp to the floor. Gigi stares wide-eyed at Ruby’s bleeding body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah attempts to start Jesse’s car. It stalls.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Shit. She tries again and again, her desperation growing. No lu

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Looks like you need a jump. Sarah startles. She steps out of the car. JENNY, the overweight, middle-aged, next-door neighbor, is standing a casserole.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have cables?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know if you have cables.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’ve never had to use them.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Check the trunk. Sarah opens the trunk of Jesse’s car. She pulls jumper cables.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Problem solved. Is Ruby inside?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, but I think she’s busy.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: That's okay, I’1l just drop this in the kitchen. The Andersons get back from Bermuda tonight. Don’t want them to come home and the cupboard’s bare. Jenny heads for the door. Sarah cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I‘ll take it for you.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I want to leave a note. Sarah grabs the casserole.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (forceful) I said I’ll take it. 75. out a set of Jenny lets go, made uneasy by Sarah’s dominant tone.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes at three-twenty- five.  131 132 133 134 135 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi is on her hands and knees scrubbing the dining room floor. Her sponge is so blood-soaked that nothing is real being cleaned. Sarah rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We have to go now. Gigi looks at Ruby’s body. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: We can’t just leave her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Look at me. The neighbors are bringing casserole. I have to learn how to jump a car. There's no time to be sentimental! Sarah heads to the kitchen with the dish. Gigi looks around, helpless. The room is in complete disarray and cleaning up suddenly seems like an impossibl task. She drops the sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO BLASTS as Sarah speeds down the highway. The ca lighter pops out, red hot, and she lights a cigarette, nodding her head to the beat. INT. GIGI’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS 133 Gigi drives in total silence, her hands at a perfect ten- two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah catches her reflection in the rearview mirror. She turns the mirror away from her and CRANKS UP THE MUSIC. INT. GIGI’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS 135 QUIET again as Gigi drives, tears in her eyes.  136 137 138 139 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car zips by the rides and rollercoasters on its way t the amusement parking lot. Gigi’s car follows behind. Sarah parks and gets out. She throws the keys as far as s can and walks away from the car. INT. GIGI’S CAR - DAY 137 Gigi looks straight ahead as Sarah climbs in the passenge seat. EXT. GIGI’S CAR/JESSE’S BUICK - DAY 138 Gigi’s car drives out of frame, and we are left for a mom with the abandoned Buick. INT. GIGI’S CAR - DAY 139 Sarah and Gigi drive in silence for a long while.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You okay? Gigi does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wanna talk about it? No response. Sarah resorts to an old tactic.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you could be like anyone in the world -

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Grace Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And why?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: (dreamy ) Because she’s perfect. Gigi exhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Better?  140 141 142 143 144 78. Gigi nods. They drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a shadowy-gray rectangular shape on the wall behin the sofa where something used to hang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newspaper is duct-taped to the front of the stainless ste refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheet hangs over the mirror attached to the chest-of- drawers. A cracked, full-length mirror is stuffed behind door. A decorative, mirrored wall-hang lined with purses scarves is scribbled-in with black marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly ZOOM IN on Sarah through the bathroom door. She standing in front of the sink, carefully applying make-up lining her eyes, powdering her nose, curling her lashes. movements are robotic, as though she has done this routin thousand times. She zips her make-up bag and exits the bathroom as we mov inside. We see that she has been standing in front of a blank wall, two round holes in the sheetrock where the mi has been ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi rushes to an outdoor tent set up as a make-up room. slips into a chair and the male MAKE-UP ARTIST begins doi her hair.

dialogues.speaker: MAKE-UP ARTIST
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Did anyone see me come in?

dialogues.speaker: MAKE-UP ARTIST
dialogues.text: They’re all over there. He touches her hair.  145 79. MAKE-UP ARTIST (CONT’D) Did you wash this? I told you not to do that. Gigi sees a group of people outside the tent. A PHOTOGRAP gestures wildly with a camera and storms away.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: MAKE-UP ARTIST
dialogues.text: Some drama. It’s supposed to rain, they’re gonna miss the light, Ruby didn’t show, blah blah... Do you know where she is?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Why would I?

dialogues.speaker: MAKE-UP ARTIST
dialogues.text: Just tell her she owes me for covering. Gigi touches her face in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Do I look different today?

dialogues.speaker: MAKE-UP ARTIST
dialogues.text: What is in your hair? He holds up a bloody lock of Gigi’s blonde hair. The wind whips the corner of the tent in a rhythmic beat. Gigi is fixated on the sound. She closes her eyes as the sound grows louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi stands on the beach, fully made-up, wearing a bikini her hair in a bouncy ponytail. She holds a big beach ball and stares out over the water.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell us what is so interesting, or are you going to make us guess?

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: You look sad. This is a tampon ad. You're comfortable, active. Be happy. Jesus. Is everybody trying to ruin my day? The OTHER MODEL in the shoot looks at her, annoyed. Gigi poses with the ball. Her smiles are forced, plastic. She fights back tears as the photographer snaps her pictu She throws the beach ball high in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of an ELEVATOR DING. Sarah stands inside. She glances at her reflection in the doors, looking quickly away again. INT. JACK’S STUDIO - DAY 147 Sarah steps out of the elevator. Jack is adjusting a light instrument. She watches him wor for a while, a sheepish grin on her face. He does not not her. She clears her throat. He looks up, but does not stop working.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Came to surprise you. Are you surprised? A very YOUNG MODEL in a robe enters from the make-up room Her hair and make-up are elaborately constructed. She sta in front of Jack. He crosses his arms and tilts his head, examining her. He nods, approvingly. The model slips out of the robe. She i wearing very little underneath. Sarah tries hard to sound cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, are you working?  148 81.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I didn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You didn’t call. This hurts, but Sarah forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t mind waiting. Unprompted, she goes to the corner and sits on a tall sto clutching her bag to her chest. She looks at the computer on the desk beside her and free Jack has been editing photos of Jesse from the shoot a fe days before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind, stronger now, whips the corner of the tent hard It sounds like a HEARTBEAT. Gigi stands motionless, changed halfway into her street clothes, haunted by the sounds. The OTHER MODEL from the shoot changes clothes beside her

dialogues.speaker: MODEL
dialogues.text: Did you take too much Percocet or something? Gigi resumes dressing.

dialogues.speaker: MODEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think happened to Ruby? I bet she finally went off the deep end. I mean, it was bound to happen. Gigi is again fixated on the tent.

dialogues.speaker: MODEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Yes. Jesus. I heard about Ruby. Gigi storms out of the tent.  149 150 151 152 82.

dialogues.speaker: MODEL
dialogues.text: When did you become a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind whips sand in the air. The sun has disappeared, the beach is misty, gloomy, ready for rain. The rhythmic SOUND OF THE TENT grows stronger, stronger.. It is a full heartbeat now. Gigi is pulled to the water, drawn by some magnetic force The HEARTBEAT grows louder. Gigi wades into the water up to her knees. She looks down searching for something. Gentle blue waves lap around her She stares at her reflection in the water. She reaches do and touches it, lovingly. Suddenly, the reflection transforms into JESSE’S FACE. A hand rises from the ocean, grabs her, pulling her complet underwater.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Gigi is pulled deeper, deeper. She kicks her legs, struggling for the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi wrestles her way back to the beach. She is drenched caked in sand. She coughs, breathing hard, and looks out over the water, horrified. Was it all in her imagination? INT. JACK’S STUDIO - DAY 152 PULSING MUSIC blasts loud through the studio. Sarah is still slumped in the corner, watching the shoot. Bright light flashes across her face every time Jack snap photo. Her patience is diminishing at a rapid rate. Jack signals to the Model with his hand, indicating that are done. She high-fives him and heads back into the make room. Sarah sits up, hopeful. Then...  153 83. The elevator opens and a dozen new MODELS walk out, chatt noisily. A few of them wave to Jack as they make their wa to the make-up room. Sarah furrows her brow. She crosses to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you still here?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: When will you be done? Jack looks up at her for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sarah -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey, do I look different today? She smiles widely.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. He walks away, preparing for the next shoot. Sarah clench her jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah walks quickly through the room, on the verge of tea her bag in hand. The MODELS bustle around, getting ready. Their sharp laughter makes Sarah prickle. A BRUNETTE MODEL runs into her, knocking the bag out of h hands. Sarah’s things go flying everywhere. She turns around, anticipating an apology, but the Brunette Model continues laughing and chatting with her friends, unaware

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  154 155 156 157 84. The Model turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE MODEL
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You spilled my shit.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE MODEL
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Pick it up. Sarah throws open the bathroom door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE MODEL
dialogues.text: (whispered) She’s always here. The other girls snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits on the toilet seat, trying to pull herself together. She grabs a piece of tissue and wipes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MODELS giggle as they lean a chair under the bathroom doorknob, locking Sarah inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah takes a deep breath and stands to leave. She tosses the tissue, catching a glimpse of herself in the large bathroom mirror. She turns away quickly. She twists the doorknob, but the door is jammed. She trie it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair wiggles violently. One of the models nods to another girl and points to the door. They share a smile.  158 159 160 161 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah bangs relentlessly on the bathroom door. She sees herself in the mirror and starts to panic. She i trapped.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hello? Can anyone hear me? INT. JACK’S STUDIO - DAY 159 The MUSIC continues to blast. Jack sits at the computer, editing the photos of Jesse, unaware of Sarah’s cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah claws at the door, desperate to be free.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Someone let me out! She goes to the bathroom mirror. She tries with all her might to pull it from the wall, but it will not budge. Sh hits it with her fists, but it will not break. She looks fully at her reflection and screams hystericall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi is damp and covered in sand. Mascara is smeared bene her eyes. She is arguing with the RECEPTIONIST, a conversation which has gone on for some time.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I’ve already told you -

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Yes, but I’ve been waiting for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Like I said before, ma’am, you don’t have an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: (an insult) Are you new?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: There’s no need for that tone.  162 86.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Please tell him I’m here. Gigi slumps back into a chair. She puts her head in her hands. A woman exits through the door beside reception. Gigi see her chance and runs through it.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Excuse me, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright white doors to various patient rooms line the hall Gigi flings them all open, searching desperately for something. She opens the door to one room and a naked woman turns around. Hideous black tick marks cover her body, prepped surgery. Gigi back away. She slams into a doctor in a handsome tie standing in the doorway. It is DR. ANDREW, 43, charming, perfect smile. The fluorescent light from the hallway shi down on him, and he looks like an angel. Gigi throws her arms around his waist. He brushes some sa from her hair.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Were you building a sandcastle? The Receptionist rounds the corner in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - I tried to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Annie -

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (annoyed) It’s Anna.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Anna, please find a room. This is my best patient. Gigi beams at him.  163 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is almost luxurious. Gigi sits on a table in a r while Dr. Andrew presses the skin around her nose.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: It’s healing nicely. Looks good. Open up. Gigi opens her robe and Dr. Andrew feels her breasts. For the first time we see small scars from her implants.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does this hurt? Gigi shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I gave you a prescription for Vicodin, just in case?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: And Xanax.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Turn for me. Gigi turns to the side.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything looks fine. You’re good to go. He snaps off a pair of rubber gloves and tosses them in a metal can.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Please - I need you to do something. Dr. Andrew sighs.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: I told you, kiddo, four in one year is all I'll do. If you want to talk about a fifth this soon you’ll have to wait or go find somebody else, but I cannot give you my blessing. Your body can’t go through that kind of trauma -

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I need you to take it out.  88.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Take what out?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: All of it. Gigi begins to cry. Dr. Andrew pats her hand, gently. He sits beside her and she melts into him.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did something... I think - I can feel it inside me. I need you to take it out, okay? Can you just - can you just take it out? Please? Please? I can’t go home. I can’t leave until you do.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hey, hey. It’s okay. Look it isn’t uncommon. After something like this. You've put a foreign object into your body... Plenty of women feel this way. Plenty of women experience some sadness, discomfort, even depression... We talked about all of this, remember? Gigi nods.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll be fine. If you want a mild anti-depressant call me and we can figure it out, okay? He starts to leave, but she clutches his hand so desperat that one of her nails breaks his skin.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow. Jesus. He looks at her, frightened and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait right here. Okay? Don’t go anywhere. Dr. Andrew leaves. Gigi gasps for breath, half smiles, simultaneously relieved and at a loss. She sees Dr. Andrew whispering to a NURSE in the hall. Th Nurse peers in the room, furrows her brow.  89. Gigi backs away from the door, realizing he is not going help her. She looks around the room, desperate. What to d now? She sees her reflection in a metal cabinet, walks up to i Touches it.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Jesse? Suddenly, the outrageously loud BEAT OF A HEART. Gigi cov her ears, as though someone had blasted music through headphones. She stumbles around the room, throwing drawers open. She spots something in one, reaches in... Dr. Andrew enters the room. Gigi’s back is to him as he steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW
dialogues.text: Gigi? Honey? Someone is on their way over here to talk to you, okay? Help you out. Okay? Kiddo? Can you hear me? Gigi turns to face him. She is holding a scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Gigi slices across both of her breasts. Blood and silicon ooze from the wounds.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! She jams the scalpel into her stomach. She pulls the scal down, cutting across her belly. Blood everywhere. She cri from the pain, brought to her knees. Her flesh rips open she makes one last cut and drops the scalpel on the groun She plunges a hand inside of her, searching for something Dr. Andrew runs from the room. She pulls her hand from her stomach. It is covered in blo empty. She looks at the blood pooling around her knees an realizes what she has done.  164 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits in the corner of the bathroom, knees pulled to chest. Her face is red and hot from crying, but now she i still, calm. A NOISE from the opposite side of the door draws her attention up. The door opens, and light from the make-up room pours in. Jack appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How long have you been in here? Sarah shrugs. He looks down at her, his expression pitiful. He sits on floor in front of her. She smiles a little at this unexpected gesture of kindness.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to stop this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stop what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This. Coming around all the time. Showing up wherever I am.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I thought you’d be happy to see me. She places a hand on his knee. He sighs. He puts his hand on hers and pats it lovingly before removing it. SARAH (CONT’D) (confused) We slept together.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You make it sound like I’m crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well - Jack holds two fingers close together as if to say ‘just little crazy.’  gl. Sarah smiles at this. They share a small laugh. Her laughter ceases as a wave of realization passes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're never going to love me. He does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sarah -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why? Why won’t you love me? He looks to the ground, does not respond. We ZOOM IN slowly on her face as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a realization) I thought I could make you love me. I thought - But it’s too hard. All of it. All of it. Be young. Be thin. Be perfect. It’s too hard. (pointed) You have no idea what I’ve done. All for you. It was all for you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What did you do? The camera stops. Time seems to stand still.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I ate a young virgin because I thought it would make me beautiful. Jack freezes, his mouth gaping. For a minute he thinks sh must be serious. Then his mouth begins to curl into a smi He starts to laugh. SARAH (CONT’D) I’m serious. It’s not a joke. He laughs harder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What’s with you today?  92.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Something’s -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Different. He looks at her for a long time. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. He holds up one finger.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One drink. One. Sarah can hardly believe it. She holds up one finger to match his.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Just one.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’1ll meet you after work. We can go wherever you want.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Just one, I swear. He starts to leave, changes his mind.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You do have beautiful eyes. He goes. Sarah is very still for a moment. She tries to control he breathing, but she is overcome. She holds a hand to her heart and closes her eyes. Fat tears roll down her face. She weeps, convulsing, for a very long time. Deep, sharp exhales. Years of longing met in a moment.  93. She is suddenly still. A look of disbelief crosses her fa Did she really get away with it? Did it really work? She scrambles off the floor and looks into the mirror. Tentative at first, she wipes away the tears and takes a moment to truly examines her face, turning this way and t She searches for some change. Her hands rise to her eyes. Her beautiful eyes. IMAGES FLASH through her mind: Jesse’s eye on the bathroo floor. Her hand picking it up. Putting it in her mouth. A smile creeps across her face. It worked. She begins to laugh. Wild, manic laughter escapes her lip She is the portrait of a deranged lunatic. She stretches top and bottom eyelids away from her eyes w her thumb and forefinger. Her mouth opens wide. Her eyes bulge out. She appears utterly grotesque. We slowly ZOOM IN on her eyes, growing wider and wider, h laughter growing louder and louder until finally... It stops.
